discourse_list.title: Intangible Assets as Public goods - Questions for Strategic Finance Core Unit

content.content: This document is dedicated to hold information from the Strategic Finance Core Unit Budget (SF-001) on whether the assets it produces by funding from MakerDAO will be made public goods for the DAO. It is posted as a main document to ensure it is easier to reference later than if the questions and answers were posted in a response thread for example concerning budget somewhere else. The latest budget request from the Core Unit can be seen here     MIP40c3-SP93: Modifying Strategic Finance Core Unit Budget (SF-001) RFC   MIP40c3-SP93: Modifying Strategic Finance Core Unit Budget (SF-001)  Preamble MIP40c3-SP#: 93 Author(s): @Aes  Contributors: Tags: core-unit, cu-sf-001, budget, dai-budget, active Status: RFC Date Applied: 2023-02-08 Date Ratified: TBD Budget Start Date: 2023-04-01 Budget End Date: 2024-04-01 Forum URL: https://forum.makerdao.com/t/mip40c3-sp93-modifying-strategic-finance-core-unit-budget-sf-001/19728 Ratification Poll URL:   Sentence Summary MIP40c3-SP93 adds the DAI budget for Core Unit SF-00…     @Aes feel free to edit this post or provide your answers as a response.  Questions   Have you acquainted yourself with the Dai & Maker Trademark Policy , so you are aware of how to utilize the Dai, Maker and MakerDAO names and logos?   Which types of tangible and intangible assets will you be producing with the funding received from MakerDAO?   Will the assets produced using MakerDAO funding be made available as public goods for the whole DAO?   Specifically:   Will appropriate Open Source Software/Creative Commons licenses be applied to the assets produced?   Will Copyright for those assets be assigned to the Dai Foundation that has as its mandate to safeguard MakerDAO intangible assets?   Will you integrate the Dai Foundation Contributor License Agreement Assistant in your Github repositories?   Will the source code/material for the assets be made publicly available? How?   Besides the MakerDAO Forum and MakerDAO Discord, which communication channels do your core unit plan to use to communicate on behalf of MakerDAO according to your mandate?   Will you ensure that relevant publishing/community websites, email and SoMe accounts and associated DNS and ENS domains used for official MakerDAO communication for which you hold Content Management rights are under ownership of Dai Foundation to ensure ultimate Maker Governance control of who is using these channels?   If you register any trademarks to represent MakerDAO funded solutions will you transfer those trademarks to Dai Foundation for safe keeping?

discourse_list.title: Intangible Assets as Public goods - Questions for Data Insights Core Unit

content.content: This document is dedicated to hold information from the Data Insights Core Unit Budget (DIN-001) on whether the assets it produces by funding from MakerDAO will be made public goods for the DAO. It is posted as a main document to ensure it is easier to reference later than if the questions and answers were posted in a response thread for example concerning budget somewhere else. The latest budget request from the Core Unit can be seen here     MIP40c3-SP96: Modify Data Insights Core Unit Budget (DIN-001) RFC   MIP40c3-SP96: Modify Data Insights Core Unit Budget (DIN-001)  Preamble MIP40c3-SP#: 96 Author(s): Tadeo (@tadeo)  Tags: cu-budget, cu-din-001 Status: RFC Date Applied: 2023-02-08 Date Ratified:  Budget Start Date: 2023-05-01  Budget End Date: 2024-04-31  Forum URL: https://forum.makerdao.com/t/mip40c3-sp96-modify-data-insights-core-unit-budget-din-001/19748 Ratification Poll URL:   Sentence Summary Data Insights is requesting a budget renewal with the intention to support the transition to End…     @tadeo feel free to edit this post or provide your answers as a response.  Questions   Have you acquainted yourself with the Dai & Maker Trademark Policy , so you are aware of how to utilize the Dai, Maker and MakerDAO names and logos?   Which types of tangible and intangible assets will you be producing with the funding received from MakerDAO?   Will the assets produced using MakerDAO funding be made available as public goods for the whole DAO?   Specifically:   Will appropriate Open Source Software/Creative Commons licenses be applied to the assets produced?   Will Copyright for those assets be assigned to the Dai Foundation that has as its mandate to safeguard MakerDAO intangible assets?   Will you integrate the Dai Foundation Contributor License Agreement Assistant in your Github repositories?   Will the source code/material for the assets be made publicly available? How?   Besides the MakerDAO Forum and MakerDAO Discord, which communication channels do your core unit plan to use to communicate on behalf of MakerDAO according to your mandate?   Will you ensure that relevant publishing/community websites, email and SoMe accounts and associated DNS and ENS domains used for official MakerDAO communication for which you hold Content Management rights are under ownership of Dai Foundation to ensure ultimate Maker Governance control of who is using these channels?   If you register any trademarks to represent MakerDAO funded solutions will you transfer those trademarks to Dai Foundation for safe keeping?

Hi Soren!     sorenpeter:  Have you acquainted yourself with the Dai & Maker Trademark Policy , so you are aware of how to utilize the Dai, Maker and MakerDAO names and logos?   Yes, I’ve personally read the document, including the appendix document.     sorenpeter:  Which types of tangible and intangible assets will you be producing with the funding received from MakerDAO?   DICU has been producing intangible assets related to data analytics, including but not limited to code for data extraction, data processing, data visualisation and data analysis.     sorenpeter:   Will the assets produced using MakerDAO funding be made available as public goods for the whole DAO?    Yes, all our work is regarded as public goods.     sorenpeter:   Will appropriate Open Source Software/Creative Commons licenses be applied to the assets produced?    Yes, as defined in Guidance for MakerDAO software developers on how to assign Copyright. Will Copyright for those assets be assigned to the Dai Foundation that has as its mandate to safeguard MakerDAO intangible assets? Yes, as defined in Guidance for MakerDAO software developers on how to assign Copyright.     sorenpeter:   Will you integrate the Dai Foundation Contributor License Agreement Assistant in your Github repositories?    Could you provide more information regarding this? I don’t think I fully understand the value of it. We have contracts with our contributors that define that all work done is owned by the Dai Foundation.     sorenpeter:   Will the source code/material for the assets be made publicly available? How?    Yes. We currently run most of our actively developed repos in private within the github organization makerdao-data. Once the repo is in production and there is a minimum level of documentation presented (most likely limited to a readme file), we will request the mirroring of it in the official makerdao repo.     sorenpeter:   Besides the MakerDAO Forum and MakerDAO Discord, which communication channels do your core unit plan to use to communicate on behalf of MakerDAO according to your mandate?    We currently maintain a few web-apps and a Notion page used as a CU website; all of them are targeted to be folded into a single web-app (makerdao.fyi). We also maintain a free and public Data API.     sorenpeter:   Will you ensure that relevant publishing/community websites, email and SoMe accounts and associated DNS and ENS domains used for official MakerDAO communication for which you hold Content Management rights are under ownership of Dai Foundation to ensure ultimate Maker Governance control of who is using these channels?    Yes, all assets managed by the Core Unit are owned by the Dai Foundation. For practical considerations, when we are heavily developing using an asset, we maintain control of it and then transfer it to Dai Foundation to be managed by their service provider, currently TechOps. This is currently the case for the domain makerdao.fyi.     sorenpeter:   If you register any trademarks to represent MakerDAO funded solutions will you transfer those trademarks to Dai Foundation for safe keeping?    Yes, this is currently not applicable as we have not registered any trademarks.

Thanks Tadeo - Appreciate it.     tadeo:      sorenpeter:   Will you integrate the Dai Foundation Contributor License Agreement Assistant in your Github repositories?    Could you provide more information regarding this? I don’t think I fully understand the value of it. We have contracts with our contributors that define that all work done is owned by the Dai Foundation.   When the CLA Assistant is integrated with a repository it check/ensures that all contributors before making a pull request have accepted the MakerDAO Individual Contributor License Agreement. It is optional to use the CLA Assistant, but it should be able to save you some work if you for example have some code where you are ready to accept contributions from external developers.     tadeo:      sorenpeter:   Will the source code/material for the assets be made publicly available? How?    Yes. We currently run most of our actively developed repos in private within the github organization makerdao-data. Once the repo is in production and there is a minimum level of documentation presented (most likely limited to a readme file), we will request the mirroring of it in the official makerdao repo.   Understood - I suggest that you identify the most important pieces of code for data extraction, data processing, data visualisation and data analysis that you have created /plan to create in your budget request together will milestones for when they will be public available and documented. Thanks again

discourse_list.title: Intangible Assets as Public goods - Questions for GovAlpha Core Unit

content.content: This document is dedicated to hold information from the GovAlpha Core Unit (GOV-001) on whether the assets it produces by funding from MakerDAO will be made public goods for the DAO. It is posted as a main document to ensure it is easier to reference later than if the questions and answers were posted in a response thread for example concerning budget somewhere else. The latest budget request from the Core Unit can be seen here     MIP40c3-SP90: GovAlpha Core Unit DAI Budget 2023-2024 RFC   MIP40c3-SP90: GovAlpha Core Unit DAI Budget 2023-2024  Preamble MIP40c3-SP#: 90 Author(s): @Patrick_J, @prose11 Contributors: Tags: budget, cu-budget, gov-001 Status: RFC Date Applied: 2023-02-07 Date Ratified: <yyyy-mm-dd> Budget Start Date: 2023-04-01 Budget End Date: 2024-03-31 Forum URL: Ratification Poll URL:   Sentence Summary MIP40c3-SP90 provides voters with a choice of three DAI budgets for the GovAlpha Core Unit for 12 months, starting on 2023-04-01 and ending on 2024-03-31.   Paragra…     @Patrick_J, @prose11 feel free to edit this post or provide your answers as a response.  Questions   Have you acquainted yourself with the Dai & Maker Trademark Policy , so you are aware of how to utilize the Dai, Maker and MakerDAO names and logos?   Which types of tangible and intangible assets will you be producing with the funding received from MakerDAO?   Will the assets produced using MakerDAO funding be made available as public goods for the whole DAO?   Specifically:   Will appropriate Open Source Software/Creative Commons licenses be applied to the assets produced?   Will Copyright for those assets be assigned to the Dai Foundation that has as its mandate to safeguard MakerDAO intangible assets?   Will you integrate the Dai Foundation Contributor License Agreement Assistant in your Github repositories?   Will the source code/material for the assets be made publicly available? How?   Besides the MakerDAO Forum and MakerDAO Discord, which communication channels do your core unit plan to use to communicate on behalf of MakerDAO according to your mandate?   Will you ensure that relevant publishing/community websites, email and SoMe accounts and associated DNS and ENS domains used for official MakerDAO communication for which you hold Content Management rights are under ownership of Dai Foundation to ensure ultimate Maker Governance control of who is using these channels?   If you register any trademarks to represent MakerDAO funded solutions will you transfer those trademarks to Dai Foundation for safe keeping?

sorenpeter:  Have you acquainted yourself with the Dai & Maker Trademark Policy , so you are aware of how to utilize the Dai, Maker and MakerDAO names and logos?   Yes     sorenpeter:  Which types of tangible and intangible assets will you be producing with the funding received from MakerDAO?   Primarily documentation     sorenpeter:  Will the assets produced using MakerDAO funding be made available as public goods for the whole DAO?   Yes     sorenpeter:  Will appropriate Open Source Software/Creative Commons licenses be applied to the assets produced?   Yes     sorenpeter:  Will Copyright for those assets be assigned to the Dai Foundation that has as its mandate to safeguard MakerDAO intangible assets?   Yes     sorenpeter:  Will you integrate the Dai Foundation Contributor License Agreement Assistant in your Github repositories?   Yes - already done     sorenpeter:  Will the source code/material for the assets be made publicly available? How?   Yes - github     sorenpeter:  Besides the MakerDAO Forum and MakerDAO Discord, which communication channels do your core unit plan to use to communicate on behalf of MakerDAO according to your mandate?   None     sorenpeter:  Will you ensure that relevant publishing/community websites, email and SoMe accounts and associated DNS and ENS domains used for official MakerDAO communication for which you hold Content Management rights are under ownership of Dai Foundation to ensure ultimate Maker Governance control of who is using these channels?   Yes - already are     sorenpeter:  If you register any trademarks to represent MakerDAO funded solutions will you transfer those trademarks to Dai Foundation for safe keeping?   Yes - although not planned

discourse_list.title: Intangible Assets as Public goods - Questions for Risk Core Unit

content.content: This document is dedicated to hold information from the Risk Core Unit Budget (RISK-001) on whether the assets it produces by funding from MakerDAO will be made public goods for the DAO. It is posted as a main document to ensure it is easier to reference later than if the questions and answers were posted in a response thread for example concerning budget somewhere else. The latest budget request from the Core Unit can be seen here     MIP40c3-SP92: Modify Risk Core Unit Budget (RISK-001) RFC   MIP40c3-SP92: Modify Risk Core Unit Budget (RISK-001)  Preamble MIP40c3-SP#: Author(s): Primoz Kordez (@Primoz) Contributors: @rema @monet-supply Tags: core-unit-budget, risk-001, mip Status: RFC Date Applied: 2023-02-08 Date Ratified: Budget Start Date: 2023-03-01 Budget End Date: 2024-02-29 Forum URL: https://forum.makerdao.com/t/mip40c3-sp92-modify-risk-core-unit-budget-risk-001/19741 Ratification Poll URL:   Sentence Summary MIP40c3-SPXX renews the Risk Core Unit Risk-001 budget from March …     @rema @monet-supply feel free to edit this post or provide your answers as a response.  Questions   Have you acquainted yourself with the Dai & Maker Trademark Policy , so you are aware of how to utilize the Dai, Maker and MakerDAO names and logos?   Which types of tangible and intangible assets will you be producing with the funding received from MakerDAO?   Will the assets produced using MakerDAO funding be made available as public goods for the whole DAO?   Specifically:   Will appropriate Open Source Software/Creative Commons licenses be applied to the assets produced?   Will Copyright for those assets be assigned to the Dai Foundation that has as its mandate to safeguard MakerDAO intangible assets?   Will you integrate the Dai Foundation Contributor License Agreement Assistant in your Github repositories?   Will the source code/material for the assets be made publicly available? How?   Besides the MakerDAO Forum and MakerDAO Discord, which communication channels do your core unit plan to use to communicate on behalf of MakerDAO according to your mandate?   Will you ensure that relevant publishing/community websites, email and SoMe accounts and associated DNS and ENS domains used for official MakerDAO communication for which you hold Content Management rights are under ownership of Dai Foundation to ensure ultimate Maker Governance control of who is using these channels?   If you register any trademarks to represent MakerDAO funded solutions will you transfer those trademarks to Dai Foundation for safe keeping?

Have you acquainted yourself with the Dai & Maker Trademark Policy, so you are aware of how to utilize the Dai, Maker and MakerDAO names and logos?  Yes  Which types of tangible and intangible assets will you be producing with the funding received from MakerDAO?  MakerDAO Risk Dashboard located at https://maker.blockanalitica.com/   Will the assets produced using MakerDAO funding be made available as public goods for the whole DAO?   Specifically: Yes, we will open source our codebase and transfer copyright to DAI Foundation   Will appropriate Open Source Software/Creative Commons licenses be applied to the assets produced?  Yes    Will Copyright for those assets be assigned to the Dai Foundation that has as its mandate to safeguard MakerDAO intangible assets?  Yes    Will you integrate the Dai Foundation Contributor License Agreement Assistant in your Github repositories?  Yes    Will the source code/material for the assets be made publicly available? How?  Yes, public repositories on GitHub under blockanalitica · GitHub     Besides the MakerDAO Forum and MakerDAO Discord, which communication channels do your core unit plan to use to communicate on behalf of MakerDAO according to your mandate?  We will use MakerDAO Risk Dashboard as our communication channel  Will you ensure that relevant publishing/community websites, email and SoMe accounts and associated DNS and ENS domains used for official MakerDAO communication for which you hold Content Management rights are under ownership of Dai Foundation to ensure ultimate Maker Governance control of who is using these channels?  Yes, but currently we do not have any  If you register any trademarks to represent MakerDAO funded solutions will you transfer those trademarks to Dai Foundation for safe keeping?  Yes, but we currently do not have a trademark representing MakerDAO
